newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunker levels stay firm.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunker levels stay firm.

text.p: Sentiment in the Singapore bunker market remained firm on Wednesday amid recent berth congestion and overnight gains in crude values further helped the rise, traders said.
However, enquiries were just moderate and shipowners were cautious in purchasing when prices were high, traders said.
Bunker 380-cst supplies were quoted at about $103 per tonne and the 180-cst grade was at around $106.
MDO and gas oil were at around $173 and $183 per tonne respectively, also up from previous levels, traders said.
